page.title: 06THE METEOROLOGICAL COLLEGE
page.content: The Meteorolgical College is a place where they teach students to become meteorolgoists.The original house on the Shinfield Park site was owned by a whisky merchant and in the 1940's the R.A.F. took it over as a training college for air crews. It started as a M.E.T. college in 1971 financed by the government. There are about 100 students and 20 teachers. Some of the equipment used are things such as the rainfall measuring computer, the electronic thermometer, the wind speed and direction machine, and barometers. The college is also linked to the 12,000,000 pound computer at the Bracknell Meteorological Centre. The students access it for training purposes. The college also has a number of its own micros. It offers different courses for students from all over the world.
